      • fixedTimeLimit

        public static <V> AttemptTimeLimiter<V> fixedTimeLimit(long duration,
                                                       @Nonnull
                                                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        For control over thread management, it is preferable to offer an ExecutorService through the other factory method, fixedTimeLimit(long, TimeUnit, ExecutorService). All calls to this method use the same cached thread pool created by Executors.newCachedThreadPool(). It is unbounded, meaning there is no limit to the number of threads it will create. It will reuse idle threads if they are available, and idle threads remain alive for 60 seconds.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the computation result
        Parameters:
        duration - that an attempt may persist before being circumvented
        timeUnit - of the 'duration' arg
        Returns:
        an AttemptTimeLimiter with a fixed time limit for each attempt

      • fixedTimeLimit

        public static <V> AttemptTimeLimiter<V> fixedTimeLimit(long duration,
                                                       @Nonnull
                                                       java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit,
                                                       @Nonnull
                                                       java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executorService)
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the computation result
        Parameters:
        duration - that an attempt may persist before being circumvented
        timeUnit - of the 'duration' arg
        executorService - used to enforce time limit
        Returns:
        an AttemptTimeLimiter with a fixed time limit for each attempt
